column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2024/11/at-the-end-of-the-day-its-the-baker-mayfield-show/|“At The End Of The Day It’s The Baker Mayfield Show”|A man who bleeds New York Giants blue and works for the team can’t convince himself that the Giants can and will beat the Bucs on Sunday.  Bob Papa has been the Giants’ radio play-by-play guy for 30 years and has worked for the team in other capacities. He’s also heard hosting weekly on SiriusXM NFL Radio. Picking winners and losers for Week 12 today
column2: Papa said he tried to find it in himself to pick the Giants but he can’t. Two big reasons were on Papa’s mind. First
column3: the Giants run defense is horrid
column4: as Papa described it. He noted that the Giants have allowed 894 rushing yards in the past five games: “And until they show that they can stop [the run]
column5: I can’t believe it.” Papa added that even if Giants replacement QB Tommy DeVito gives the team a spark
column6: he doesn’t think it will overcome the many deficiencies of the Giants defense. Papa also thinks Baker Mayfield will be a scrambling threat and pick apart the Giants’ weak secondary just enough. “At the end of the day
column8: ” he said. Joe agrees that it is time for Mayfield to put the Bucs on his back. He’s certainly played well
column9: but this is a game he cannot allow his team to lose. The Bucs’ run game should dominate — the Giants allow a league-worst 5.3 yards per carry — but Mayfield will have opportunities that a true franchise QB needs to make to bury a poor team.|2024-11-22 17:15:00|254|19|3|Baker Mayfield|Doubtful outlook on Giants vs. Bucs game.|7|Mixed sentiments ranging from optimism to skepticism and humor regarding upcoming games and players' performances.|"{""commenter0"": {""username"": ""Stillabucsfan""

column2: Bucs coach Todd Bowles didn’t seem overly excited to get him back on the field that soon. The All-Pro tackle sprained his knee in the second quarter against the 49ers. Fortunately
column3: it was just a sprained MCL. So Wirfs was only going to be out a short time. The bye
column5: came at a perfect time. And while Bowles admitted Wirfs may play — Bowles said earlier Wirfs would be gametime decision — Bowles said today the Bucs have to factor in the big picture when deciding whether to give Wirfs the green light or not Sunday. “We want to be smart and make sure he’s okay for the rest of the way
column6: ” Bowles said. “He’s getting a little better day by day. “We’ll see. It’s going to go right up until Sunday for him.” Sadly
column7: the Bucs have painted themselves into a corner. The Bucs likely cannot lose two games the rest of the way if they hope to play meaningful games in January. That’s what happens when you can’t win close games. That’s what happens when your defense can’t close the door. That’s what happens when your defense bends over for your opponents. column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2024/11/calls-for-victory-and-desperation/|Calls For Victory And “Desperation”|So which Bucs wide receiver will expose the routinely shaky Giants secondary on Sunday? Well
column2: perhaps none will have to. The Giants rank last in the NFL against the run (5.3 yards per carry allowed) and the Bucs have turned into a punishing running team. Yes
column3: the Giants (2-8) are bad and possibly imploding after a strange quarterback change. The Bucs also are bad at 4-6
column4: but they’re not falling apart and they’ve played a brutal schedule. So NFL pundits

column6: are unified in their belief that the Bucs will beat the Giants on Sunday. Former Bucs quarterback Chris Simms sees a 27-20 victory for the Bucs. First
column7: Simms isn’t caught up in the hype surrounding Giants No. 3 QB Tommy DeVito getting the start. “To think that he can just jump in here and play really high level football
column8: I gotta see that to believe it
column9: ” Simms said on Pro Football Talk. “Now we know this is a Bucs defense that’s not real good. So there might be some plays there to be had.” Simms sounded like he wanted to pick the Bucs in a blowout but couldn’t justify it. “Is there anybody there with the Bucs at wide receiver that can expose [the Giants’ secondary] right now? That’s what I worry about a little bit

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2024/11/liam-coen-receivers-need-to-get-open/|Liam Coen: Receivers Need To Get Open|Joe thought the loss to the 49ers was the first time since Mike Evans and Chris Godwin got hurt that the offense really missed them. It wasn’t so much that the two star receivers weren’t available. Yesterday
